excerpt: Colorful temple known for mischievous resident monkeys & a striking devotional image of Krishna.
detail_description: Thakur Shri Banke Bihari Ji Temple in Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh, is a vibrant Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Krishna. Established in 1864 by Swami Haridas, it is a revered place of worship for Krishna devotees. The temple is known for its mischievous resident monkeys and houses a striking devotional image of Krishna. Visitors are advised to be cautious during peak times like Janmashtami due to large crowds.
name: Shri Banke Bihari Temple, Vrindavan
address: near Banke Bihari temple, Bankebihari Colony, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Scenic temple dating back to the 16th century, with a terra cotta exterior & river views.
detail_description: Shri Radha Madan Mohan Ji Temple, also known as Madan Mohan Temple, is a scenic 16th-century temple with a terra cotta exterior and stunning river views. It is part of a trail that includes several other temples such as Radha Damodar Temple, Radha Gokulananda Temple, and more. Each temple has its own unique architecture and atmosphere, offering rich oral narratives and early Vrindavan temple designs.
name: Shri Radha Madan Mohan Ji Temple, Vrindavan
address: VIP Rd, near Banke Bihari Temple, Goda Vihar, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Holy place with twisting trees, where Krishna is said to perform his divine dance each night.
detail_description: Nidhivan, also known as Seva Kunj, is a revered and mystical garden in Vrindavan, India. It is believed to be the divine abode of Lord Krishna where he performs his celestial dance each night with the Gopis, who are said to come to life as twisting trees. This sacred grove exudes an aura of enchantment and spirituality, drawing visitors seeking a unique and spiritual experience.
name: Nidhivan
address: HMMX+M5P, Nidhivan Rd, Gotam Nagar, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Expansive & ornately decorated temple complex with a museum, restaurant, bakery & ashram.
detail_description: The Iskcon Temple, also known as Sri Krishna-Balaram Mandir, is a spiritual haven located in Vrindavan. It combines traditional Vedic architecture with modern design and is a place where devotees from all over the world come together to chant and dance in joyous devotion. The temple complex includes stunning deities of Krishna, Balarama, and Radha-Shyamasundara, along with facilities such as a guesthouse, restaurant, and bakery.
name: Sri Sri Krishna Balaram Mandir (ISKCON Vrindavan)
address: Bhaktivedanta Swami Marg, Raman Reiti, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Tiny, white-domed temple in a grove, linked to a legend about Lord Krishna & popular for meditation.
detail_description: Seva Kunj in Vrindavan is a serene garden where the eternal love story of Lord Krishna and Radha unfolds. Legend has it that this is where Krishna selflessly served Radha, and their divine rendezvous continues to take place here every night. The secluded garden is adorned with ancient trees, flowers, and shrines dedicated to the divine couple.
name: Seva Kunj, Vrindavan
address: Near, Kunj Gali, Radha Vallabh Temple Rd, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

detail_description: Keshi Ghat, situated along the Parikrama Margin in Gotam Nagar, Vrindavan, is a historic site constructed by Queen Laxmi Devi during the 17th century. This ghat holds significant religious importance as it is surrounded by several important temples in Vrindavan, making it a focal point for spiritual activities and cultural experiences.
name: Keshi Ghat
address: Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Hindu temple with carved pillars & domes, set in gardens with fountains & illuminated at night.
name: Prem Mandir, Vrindavan
address: Sri Kripalu Maharaj Ji Marg, Raman Reiti, Vrindavan, Rajpur Khadar, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Majestic 16th-century Hindu temple featuring a red sandstone facade, raised plinth & marble altar.
detail_description: In the heart of Vrindavan stands the majestic Govind Dev Ji Temple, a 16th-century Hindu temple with a striking red sandstone facade and a marble altar. This historical site was constructed by Raja Man Singh in 1590, incorporating western, Hindu, and Muslim architectural elements. The temple's seven-storey structure bears resemblance to European cathedrals and is said to have been built with red sandstone donated by Emperor Akbar himself.
name: Govind Dev Ji Temple, Vrindavan
address: HMJX+GQV, Govind Dev Temple, Raman Reiti, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Expansive & ornately decorated temple complex with a museum, restaurant, bakery & ashram.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Vrindavan, the Sri Sri Krishna Balaram Mandir (ISKCON Vrindavan) is a breathtaking temple complex that invites visitors to delve into the rich tapestry of Hindu spirituality. This stunning site features a golden dome and intricate marble artwork, creating an atmosphere of divine beauty. As you wander through its expansive grounds, you'll find not only places for worship but also a museum, restaurant, bakery, and ashram that enhance your experience.
name: Sri Sri Krishna Balaram Mandir (ISKCON Vrindavan)
address: Bhaktivedanta Swami Marg, Raman Reiti, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: 19th-century Hindu temple featuring twisted marble pillars & a hall with Belgian chandeliers.
detail_description: Shahji Temple, situated near Nidhi Van in Vrindavan, is a 19th-century Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Krishna. Built in 1860 by Shah Kundan Lal, the temple showcases exquisite marble sculptures and a blend of Mughal and Hindu architectural styles. The presiding deity, Chhote Radha Raman, attracts numerous tourists with its unique craftsmanship.
name: Shahji Temple, Vrindavan
address: Gotam Nagar, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

name: Radha raman hotel
address: Raman Reiti, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

detail_description: Shri Radha Damodar Mandir is an ancient temple that enshrines the deities of Radha and Damodar, deeply rooted in the rich history of Gaudiya Vaishnavism tradition. The spiritual ambiance within offers a profound sense of tranquility to all visitors. This Krishna temple also serves as a place of worship for jeev goswami during summer, with a midday closure and reopening at 5 pm.
name: Shri Radha Damodar Mandir
address: 69, Sewa Kunj Rd, opp. Radha Damodar Temple, Gotam Nagar, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

detail_description: Prem Mandir Canteen is located in Vrindavan, India and is a unique spiritual and cultural center. The temple was constructed by Pujya Swami Ji Maharaj and serves as a peaceful gathering place for devotees. The canteen offers delicious and high-quality food with an emphasis on hygiene. Visitors can enjoy a variety of sweet dishes and fast foods, as well as purchase Prasadam.
name: Prem mandir
address: HMCC+7FQ, Prem मंदिर, Chaitanya Vihar, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Vrindavan is a holy town in Uttar Pradesh, northern India. The Hindu deity Krishna is said to have spent his childhood here. It’s home to temples, many dedicated to Krishna and his lover, the deity Radha. At Banke Bihari Temple, the curtain in front of Krishna’s statue is opened and closed every few minutes. At Radha Raman Temple, a gold plate beside Krishna signifies Radha. Prem Mandir is a huge white marble temple.
detail_description: Vrindavan, located in Uttar Pradesh, India, is a sacred town associated with the Hindu deity Krishna. This spiritual destination is renowned for its numerous temples dedicated to Krishna and Radha. The Banke Bihari Temple features a unique ritual of opening and closing the curtain in front of Krishna's statue. Another notable site is the Radha Raman Temple where a gold plate next to Krishna symbolizes Radha.
name: Vrindavan
address: Uttar Pradesh, India

excerpt: Hindu temple with carved pillars & domes, set in gardens with fountains & illuminated at night.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Vrindavan, Prem Mandir stands as a breathtaking testament to devotion and artistry. Known as the 'Temple of Love,' this magnificent Hindu temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna and Radha Rani, embodying their eternal bond. Constructed over 11 years by a skilled team of artisans from Gujarat, it showcases intricate carvings on its pillars and domes that reflect the rich cultural heritage of India.
name: Prem Mandir, Vrindavan
address: Sri Kripalu Maharaj Ji Marg, Raman Reiti, Vrindavan, Rajpur Khadar, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Ornately decorated Hindu temple constructed around 1542 & housing a historic Krishna figure.
detail_description: Shri Radha Raman Mandir, situated in the sacred town of Vrindavan, India, is a highly venerated temple dedicated to Lord Krishna in his Radha Raman form. Established around 1542 by Gopala Bhatta Goswami, a prominent disciple of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, this temple holds immense spiritual significance for devotees and tourists alike.
name: Shri Radha Raman Temple, Vrindavan
address: Keshi Ghat, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Elaborate, multitiered, blue-painted place of worship with an animatronic Lord Krishna tableau.
detail_description: Nestled just 3 kilometers from the Vrindavan Railway Station along the Mathura-Vrindavan road, Shri Pagal Baba Temple stands as a stunning testament to devotion and artistry. This ten-story marvel, adorned in serene blue hues and crafted from exquisite white marble, is dedicated to Lord Krishna and was established by the revered saint Sri Sheela Nand Ji Maharaj, also known as Pagal Baba. Visitors often remark on the temple's uplifting atmosphere that echoes the spirit of its founder.
name: Shri Pagal Baba Temple, Vrindavan
address: Liladham,Pagalbaba Ashram Mathura Road, Mathura - Vrindavan Marg, in front of pagal baba mandir, Marg, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Hindu temple with carved pillars & domes, set in gardens with fountains & illuminated at night.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Vrindavan, Prem Mandir stands as a magnificent testament to devotion and artistry, brought to life under the guidance of Jagadguru Shri Kripalu Ji Maharaj, a revered follower of Radha Krishna. This stunning temple is particularly enchanting at night when its intricate designs come alive with vibrant lights. Crafted by skilled artisans from Gujarat over an impressive span of 11 years, this architectural marvel involved the dedication of around 1,000 workers.
name: Prem Mandir, Vrindavan
address: Sri Kripalu Maharaj Ji Marg, Raman Reiti, Vrindavan, Rajpur Khadar, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

detail_description: Nestled in the enchanting city of Vrindavan, Gopeshwar Mahadev Temple stands as a significant spiritual haven dedicated to Lord Shiva in His revered Gopeshwar form. This ancient temple is not just a place of worship but also an embodiment of tranquility, attracting countless devotees who seek divine blessings. Surrounded by lush greenery and situated near Vamshivat, it offers a serene atmosphere that enhances the spiritual experience for visitors.
name: Shri Gopishwar Mahadev Temple
address: Wanshivat, Near Temple, Goda Vihar, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of a sacred town, Sri Banke Bihari Temple stands as a beacon of devotion and spirituality. This temple is renowned for its bustling atmosphere, drawing countless visitors throughout the day. The centerpiece of this revered site is the Murti of Banke Bihari, which was discovered nearby in Nidhivan by the esteemed Swami Haridas.
name: Banke bihari mandir
address: HM8Q+CVG, Maruti Nagar Colony, Panigaon Khader, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Sandstone Krishna temple from 1585, with Hindu & Islamic elements & flower-covered statues.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Vrindavan, the Shri Radhavallabh Lal Ji Temple is a stunning sandstone structure dating back to 1585. This temple beautifully blends Hindu and Islamic architectural elements, adorned with intricately flower-covered statues that captivate visitors.
name: Shri Radhavallabh Lal Ji Temple, Vrindavan
address: Radha Vallabh Temple Rd, old city, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

detail_description: In the heart of Vrindavan stands the magnificent Banke Bihari Temple, a stunning Rajasthani-style Hindu temple devoted to Lord Krishna. Built in the 19th century, this sacred site exudes a vibrant atmosphere where devotees can immerse themselves in the divine presence of Lord Krishna. Knowledgeable guides offer insights into the temple's intricate architecture and share captivating stories of devotion that resonate through its halls.
name: Banke Bihari Temple
address: Goda Vihar, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

detail_description: Located in the holy city of Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh, Shri Priyakant Ju Temple is a stunning structure shaped like a lotus flower. Dedicated to Lord Krishna and Radha, the temple houses beautiful deities of the divine couple. It is believed that here, Lord Krishna appears as Kant Ju and Radharani as Priya Ji to bless the devotees.
name: Shri Priyakant Ju Temple, Vrindavan
address: HJ7Q+9J9, Rina Rd, Raman Reiti, Vrindavan, Allhepur, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Daily evening prayer rituals are performed at these sacred riverside steps backed by temples.
detail_description: Vishram Ghat, nestled along the serene banks of the Yamuna River in Mathura, is a site steeped in rich history and spirituality. This sacred ghat is renowned for its evening prayer rituals that take place against a backdrop of ancient temples. According to legend, it was here that Lord Krishna rested after vanquishing the evil King Kansa.
name: Vishram Ghat
address: 650/1, Chhonka Pada, Choubey Para, Mathura, Uttar Pradesh 281001, India

excerpt: Manicured gardens & a massive Mata Vaishno Devi statue in a sprawling Hindu temple complex.
detail_description: Maa Vaishno Devi Dham in Vrindavan is a sprawling Hindu temple complex with manicured gardens and a massive 141 feet tall idol of Goddess Durga, along with Lord Hanuman bowing down. This pilgrimage site at the top of Trikuta Mountains has been sacred for centuries, attracting millions of devotees seeking blessings and spiritual elevation.
name: Chaar Dham Vrindavan
address: Bhaktivedanta Swami Marg, Vrindavan, Allhepur, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Vrindavan, Munger Raj Mandir is a captivating temple that beckons visitors with its lush greenery and serene atmosphere. Established in 1932 by Raja Raghunandan Prasad Singh, this sacred site is dedicated to Radha and her beloved gopis, featuring stunning statues that bring their stories to life. The journey through the vibrant garden filled with kadamb trees and blooming flowers leads you to a tranquil shrine where spirituality thrives.
name: Munger Raj Mandir
address: Shankar Mandal Rd, Vatsalya Gram, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

detail_description: Located just 1 km from the city center of Vrindavan, Shri Radha Damodar Mandir is a significant site among the seven Goswami temples. It is home to the revered Giriraj Shila, a sacred stone given to Srila Sanatana Goswami by Sri Krishna. The temple also houses idols of Sri Radha Rani and Lalita Sakshi alongside Sri Damodar, making it an important pilgrimage destination for devotees.
name: Shri Radha Damodar Mandir
address: HM85+2PG, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

excerpt: Archaeological museum founded in the 19th century, exhibiting local pottery, sculpture & artifacts.

Established in the 19th century, this archaeological gem showcases an impressive array of artifacts that span centuries, including exquisite pottery and sculptures from the Kushan and Gupta eras.
name: Government Museum, Mathura

detail_description: Shri Jugal Kishore Ji Temple, also known as Kesighata temple, is located near the picturesque Kesi Ghat in Mathura. This sacred site holds historical significance as it is believed to be where Lord Krishna defeated Kesi. The temple houses an idol of Lord Vishnu, also known as Lord Sri Ranganatha or Rangji, resting on the divine Seshnag.
name: Shri Jugal Kishore Ji Temple, Vrindavan
address: HMPX+PGW, Gotam Nagar, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

detail_description: Shree Geeta Mandir, also known as Birla Mandir, is a renowned Hindu temple located in the Mathura district of Uttar Pradesh. The temple features stunning architecture with red sandstone and showcases a fusion of Hindu and western styles. Inside, visitors can admire idols of Lord Krishna, Narayana, Rama, Goddess Lakshmi, and Sita.
name: Shree Geeta Mandir

detail_description: Tilak Dwar, also known as Tilak Gate, is a prominent landmark in the city of Jaipur, India. It is a historical structure that holds great cultural and architectural significance. The gate is adorned with intricate designs and carvings that reflect the rich heritage of the region. Visitors can admire the impressive craftsmanship and learn about the gate's historical importance. Tilak Dwar stands as a testament to Jaipur's royal legacy and offers visitors a glimpse into the city's vibrant past.
name: Tilak Dwar
address: Mathura, Uttar Pradesh 281001, India

detail_description: The Krishna Das Kaviraj Goswami Memorial is a serene and beautiful tribute to the renowned saint and poet, Krishna Das Kaviraj Goswami. Situated in a peaceful setting, the memorial offers visitors a chance to learn about the life and teachings of this revered figure. The memorial features informative displays, artifacts, and exhibits that provide insight into the spiritual legacy of Krishna Das Kaviraj Goswami.
name: Krishna Das Kaviraj Goswami Memorial
address: 96, Sewa Kunj Rd, Gotam Nagar, Vrindavan, Mathura, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India

detail_description: The Shri Garud Govind Temple in Vrindavan is a historical Hindu temple established during the Mughal period. The temple was built in 1862 after the discovery of an idol of Banke-Bihari, also known as Sri Krishna, in NidhiVana. Swami Haridas is believed to have founded the temple. It is renowned for its ancientness, with a history spanning 5000 years.
name: Shri Garud Govind Temple, Shri Vrindavan
address: मेरा वृंदावन वाला गेट, छठिकारा वृंदावन, near छटीकरा के पास, Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh 281121, India
